Use correct URI in show schema for datasource table command

This patch changes the command to use datasource id in API
request URI. It uses currently datasource name though Congress
server expects recieving datasource id in URI.

subject: Add validation to datasource creation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-21 17:41:01.000000000', 'files': ['congress/managers/datasource.py'], 'message': 'Add validation to datasource creation

Previously, there was no validation performed when creating a datasource,
so if you failed to supply any --config options, you got an internal
server error.

This also fixes a bug where if the DSE creation-service fails, the code
fails to destroy the policy it already created before re-raising the
exception.

Change-Id: Ifd8e38ca5b9fead46e5d3fc9dcc4faa77ea42ab7
'}]
commit_message:
Add validation to datasource creation

Previously, there was no validation performed when creating a datasource,
so if you failed to supply any --config options, you got an internal
server error.

This also fixes a bug where if the DSE creation-service fails, the code
fails to destroy the policy it already created before re-raising the
exception.

Change-Id: Ifd8e38ca5b9fead46e5d3fc9dcc4faa77ea42ab7

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-07 01:57:30.000000000', 'files': ['lib/img-functions'], 'message': 'Try 5 times for rmdir command call after umount

Sometime, we will get "Device or resource busy" during the mount point
deleting, umount return 0, but the resouce is busy for a while, so need
to add sleep interval to wait resource free, then we can delete it.
Change-Id: Idaa219d12e847824960eec8907739add5d619d1a
Closes-Bug: 1332521
'}]
commit_message:
Try 5 times for rmdir command call after umount

Sometime, we will get "Device or resource busy" during the mount point
deleting, umount return 0, but the resouce is busy for a while, so need
to add sleep interval to wait resource free, then we can delete it.
Change-Id: Idaa219d12e847824960eec8907739add5d619d1a
Closes-Bug: 1332521

subject: Fix bug in execute[] when rule inserted before data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 19:59:59.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/test_congress.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py'], 'message': 'Fix bug in execute[] when rule inserted before data

Previously, inserting a rule with execute[p(...)] in the head would
sometimes fail to cause actions to execute immediately even when
the data that the body utilizes was already available.

This change fixes that bug by broadening the dependency analysis
performed during rule insertion.

Change-Id: I7220699daa8b4ce145fefc7c23ed3fcd71317338
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in execute[] when rule inserted before data

Previously, inserting a rule with execute[p(...)] in the head would
sometimes fail to cause actions to execute immediately even when
the data that the body utilizes was already available.

This change fixes that bug by broadening the dependency analysis
performed during rule insertion.

Change-Id: I7220699daa8b4ce145fefc7c23ed3fcd71317338

The snapshot file support bypasses the database when inserting rules into the
policy engine, so it makes it possible to insert rules into the engine without
the rules being in the db.  That means if Congress tries to synchronize rules

Change-Id: Icbd6d1e1f1233aa00157d036f697933da07347f7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for policy snapshot file

The snapshot file support bypasses the database when inserting rules into the
policy engine, so it makes it possible to insert rules into the engine without
the rules being in the db.  That means if Congress tries to synchronize rules
with the db, the synchronizer will delete rules from the snapshot because the
rules do not exist in the db.

Change-Id: Icbd6d1e1f1233aa00157d036f697933da07347f7

commit_message:
Reject rules inserted into non persisted policies

This patch rejects rule creation requests that insert rules into
non persisted policies, i.e. datasource policies with error message
"Rules not permitted on non persisted policies".

Change-Id: I35d650a60213a31c090b91b654bb7259b7f03ed0
Closes-bug: 1436151

subject: remove wait_for from glance-api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-14 18:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['docker/glance/glance-api/start.sh'], 'message': 'remove wait_for from glance-api

For some reason glance sometimes fails to permanently find keystone
while other services do find keystone.  The host also has full access
to keystone.  Change wait_for to fail_unless.

This could be a docker bug, a wait_for bug, or some other problem.

Change-Id: I02d611d65b7ffddb9c27101fd60e2a8b7cc25658
'}]
commit_message:
remove wait_for from glance-api

For some reason glance sometimes fails to permanently find keystone
while other services do find keystone.  The host also has full access
to keystone.  Change wait_for to fail_unless.

This could be a docker bug, a wait_for bug, or some other problem.

Change-Id: I02d611d65b7ffddb9c27101fd60e2a8b7cc25658

commit_message:
rename keystone_v2_authenticate method

In puppet-neutron, keystone_v2_authenticate already exists and is in
colision with the keystone_v2_authenticate in puppet-heat.

While we move the whole method in puppet-openstacklib, let's just rename
the method from keystone_v2_authenticate to keystone_v2_auth.

Closes-bug #1429096

Change-Id: I15b6d0550bb3baef37d7536d264b822768802ad0

commit_message:
Rename handle_request to neutron_handle_request

To avoid a future colision with other modules, we rename the
handle_request method with a prefix (module name).

Same patch in puppet-heat: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162292/
Closes-bug: #1429096

Change-Id: If477dd15b1ffeb957481494a1da0b3e8ab29e299

subject: [install-guide] Replace LVMISCSIDriver with LVMVolumeDriver
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-21 18:50:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_cinder-storage-node.xml'], 'message': '[install-guide] Replace LVMISCSIDriver with LVMVolumeDriver

This solves the following issues:

LVMISCSIDriver is deprecated, you should now just use LVMVolumeDriver
and specify target_helper for the target driver you wish to use.

Also, use a specific backend section for LVM rather than the default
section.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If2e356553ea699f23a3462d0d73a92b1ab0c6bd6
'}]
commit_message:
[install-guide] Replace LVMISCSIDriver with LVMVolumeDriver

This solves the following issues:

LVMISCSIDriver is deprecated, you should now just use LVMVolumeDriver
and specify target_helper for the target driver you wish to use.

Also, use a specific backend section for LVM rather than the default
section.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If2e356553ea699f23a3462d0d73a92b1ab0c6bd6

initially split keystoneclient-federation particularly to separate
additional dependencies. It was decided that it is more correct to call

commit_message:
Rename keystoneclient-federation to saml2

Federation is becoming a very core part of keystone's scope. We had
initially split keystoneclient-federation particularly to separate
additional dependencies. It was decided that it is more correct to call
this repository keystoneclient-saml2 as this is what will be there and
we may not want to lump together all federation plugins in one repo.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Ia25e14a6afa939590ebba3a91973ceee4a8eaee2

commit_message:
Adding nova creating and deleting for client

This is a way to create and delete nova instances leveraging an LWRP and
the fog gem.

This is just a POC on how to do it; but i think with this we can cargo
cult a lot of code to get all of fog supported.

Change-Id: I6ba402611d3f4a05470a01eed9c99abcb002045f

subject: Modify openrc variables for broken clients
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-17 18:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_glance-verify.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_cinder-verify.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_keystone-openrc.xml'], 'message': 'Modify openrc variables for broken clients

Enabling the newer versions of APIs for clients
requires different environment variables in openrc
files. For example:

1) With keystone API version 3, the glance client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Version 0.16 apparently fixed this issue, but Ubuntu
   currently includes 0.15.

2) With glance API version 2, the glance client requires
   OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

3) With keystone API version 3, the cinder client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Impacts all versions.

4) With keystone API version 3, the swift client still
   expects a versioned endpoint and the "-V 3" command-line
   option. Best I can tell, it does not support environment
   variables for API version. Luckily, the other clients
   seem to work with a versioned endpoint, so we can
   configure it globally, at least for now.

5) With cinder API version 2, the cinder client requires
   OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

I suspect some of these issues originate from distributions
packaging older versions of the clients and expect more
changes to these variables as we continue testing of
Kilo. I suggest we make these changes in the particular
service chapters to keep better track of them.

Change-Id: I617e3eaf86bbd33e859930baaa1e5cb4bb5850f0
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
'}]
commit_message:
Modify openrc variables for broken clients

Enabling the newer versions of APIs for clients
requires different environment variables in openrc
files. For example:

1) With keystone API version 3, the glance client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Version 0.16 apparently fixed this issue, but Ubuntu
   currently includes 0.15.

2) With glance API version 2, the glance client requires
   OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

3) With keystone API version 3, the cinder client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Impacts all versions.

4) With keystone API version 3, the swift client still
   expects a versioned endpoint and the "-V 3" command-line
   option. Best I can tell, it does not support environment
   variables for API version. Luckily, the other clients
   seem to work with a versioned endpoint, so we can
   configure it globally, at least for now.

5) With cinder API version 2, the cinder client requires
   OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

I suspect some of these issues originate from distributions
packaging older versions of the clients and expect more
changes to these variables as we continue testing of
Kilo. I suggest we make these changes in the particular
service chapters to keep better track of them.

Change-Id: I617e3eaf86bbd33e859930baaa1e5cb4bb5850f0
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Add coe attribute to BayModel

Add the Core Orchestration Engine (coe) attribute to the BayModel API, model, and DB objects to be used by the Heat Conductor Handler when creating a Bay.
1) Add coe attribute to BayModel models
2) Use coe attribute in heat handler's get_template_definition(...) calls

Partially implements https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/multiple-bay-templates

Change-Id: I3383f6efa3f8839b8f0735ea022307a2d9549d65

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-14 18:49:56.000000000', 'files': ['reference/new-projects-requirements.rst'], 'message': 'Let projects add repos without prior-approval

Some OpenStack projects are adding git repos at a moderate pace
and generally the TC is rubber-stamping them as long as the PTL
approves.  Explicitly codify that this is desirable -- the TC
doesn't really care how many git repos it takes to accomplish a
task, so as long as a new repo fits within the existing mission
statement, indicate that it is permissible to add it without
prior TC approval.

This is not strictly a "new project requirement", however, this
document seems to be the best existing place to add it as it
relates to project creation.

Change-Id: I34acfe4ffe5a0af6a941e70a5315a07d036e6c24
'}]
commit_message:
Let projects add repos without prior-approval

Some OpenStack projects are adding git repos at a moderate pace
and generally the TC is rubber-stamping them as long as the PTL
approves.  Explicitly codify that this is desirable -- the TC
doesn't really care how many git repos it takes to accomplish a
task, so as long as a new repo fits within the existing mission
statement, indicate that it is permissible to add it without
prior TC approval.

This is not strictly a "new project requirement", however, this
document seems to be the best existing place to add it as it
relates to project creation.

Change-Id: I34acfe4ffe5a0af6a941e70a5315a07d036e6c24

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-21 20:25:31.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Adding the Puppet modules to OpenStack

The Puppet modules for OpenStack bring scalable and reliable IT
automation to OpenStack cloud deployments.
They enable system administrators to automate any lifecycle stage
of their OpenStack infrastructure.

The code base has existed for more than 3 years in the stackforge code
namespace. The contributors come from various companies including Puppet Labs,
Red Hat, iWeb, Time Warner Cable, Aptira, Mirantis and more.

Our meetings are weekly, on IRC, and our roadmap is transparent and
managed on Launchpad again using standard OpenStack community practices
[1].

Our group wanted to elect and only one (me) applied [2] so we have a
PTL of this project.

This patch is an official request to be part of the big tent and become
an official project.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Puppet
[2] https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg49290.html

Change-Id: Ic6257647916e8fabf9f7032f2db2415696078ce7
'}]
commit_message:
Adding the Puppet modules to OpenStack

The Puppet modules for OpenStack bring scalable and reliable IT
automation to OpenStack cloud deployments.
They enable system administrators to automate any lifecycle stage
of their OpenStack infrastructure.

The code base has existed for more than 3 years in the stackforge code
namespace. The contributors come from various companies including Puppet Labs,
Red Hat, iWeb, Time Warner Cable, Aptira, Mirantis and more.

Our meetings are weekly, on IRC, and our roadmap is transparent and
managed on Launchpad again using standard OpenStack community practices
[1].

Our group wanted to elect and only one (me) applied [2] so we have a
PTL of this project.

This patch is an official request to be part of the big tent and become
an official project.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Puppet
[2] https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg49290.html

Change-Id: Ic6257647916e8fabf9f7032f2db2415696078ce7

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-concat to 1.2.1 in fixtures

Puppet Labs is in the process of releasing a 2.0.0 version of
puppetlabs-concat, which will have many breaking changes that affect
many dependent modules. Changes have been merged to master, but not yet
released. While we figure out what changes we need to make in our own
modules and wait for updates in dependent modules, we should just pin
to a stable version.

Change-Id: I8a3a0ef54ffeb55cf59ba8f9b79340d64065c905

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-concat to 1.2.1 in fixtures

Puppet Labs is in the process of releasing a 2.0.0 version of
puppetlabs-concat, which will have many breaking changes that affect
many dependent modules. Changes have been merged to master, but not yet
released. While we figure out what changes we need to make in our own
modules and wait for updates in dependent modules, we should just pin
to a stable version.

Change-Id: I27378d246892e2bb67b89d2b1d50fe957b3eedb5

WIP: Adds dhcp agent component of the neutron container set.

the neutron container set. This patch adds the neutron dhcp
agent.

commit_message:
WIP: Fixes errors in Neutron Linux Bridge Agent

Previously, the linuxbridge agent was not loading it's config
file. This PS adds --config-file flags to the lb-agent process
The PS also adds the iproute package needed for the vxlan plugin
and removes the unnecessary soft link.

Partially Implements: Container set compute-operation-neutron

Change-Id: I1d7798acbb3b07763b731343aa31c42b6a699ef1

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-14 20:28:59.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Adding MagnetoDB to OpenStack

MagnetoDB is a key-value store service for OpenStack. It provides horizontally
scalable, queryable storage, accessible via REST API.

MagnetoDB has been designed and developed in order to provide:

 - Easy integration: REST API. Support Amazon DynamoDB API
 - OpenStack interoperability: integrated with Keystone. Follows OpenStack
   design tenets, packaging and distribution
 - Database pluggability: supports Cassandra, any other databases could
   be easily added
 - Horizontal scalability: MagnetoDB is scalable lineary by amount of
   data and requests

   handling requests

Ilya Sviridov was choosen as PTL via elections.

MagnetoDB team has bi-weekly IRC meetings, uses Launchpad, openstack-dev mail
list,  spec repo for issue, roadmap traking and communication publicly.

MagnetoDB employs OpenStack Tempest for functional testing running within
gates on community resources.

OpenStack Keystone is used for authentification.

MagnetoDB sends usage data to OpenStack Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I46172d745ffc12df14cd3697c9ce4dcad0602a1f
'}]
commit_message:
Adding MagnetoDB to OpenStack

MagnetoDB is a key-value store service for OpenStack. It provides horizontally
scalable, queryable storage, accessible via REST API.

MagnetoDB has been designed and developed in order to provide:

 - Easy integration: REST API. Support Amazon DynamoDB API
 - OpenStack interoperability: integrated with Keystone. Follows OpenStack
   design tenets, packaging and distribution
 - Database pluggability: supports Cassandra, any other databases could
   be easily added
 - Horizontal scalability: MagnetoDB is scalable lineary by amount of
   data and requests
 - High availability: just one working API node is enough to continue
   handling requests

Ilya Sviridov was choosen as PTL via elections.

MagnetoDB team has bi-weekly IRC meetings, uses Launchpad, openstack-dev mail
list,  spec repo for issue, roadmap traking and communication publicly.

MagnetoDB employs OpenStack Tempest for functional testing running within
gates on community resources.

OpenStack Keystone is used for authentification.

MagnetoDB sends usage data to OpenStack Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I46172d745ffc12df14cd3697c9ce4dcad0602a1f

subject: Add test for user_cache
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-17 05:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Add test for user_cache

Since we intend to invalidate the user_cache, and properties and caching
decorators don't play nicely, we split this into the property and a
getter which can be called explicitly.

Note that this test also uncovered a bug in user_cache, which was that
it called a non-existent task.

Change-Id: Ica04a82242cf4724155f99de5b8d3d9c356a8ec4
"}]
commit_message:
Add test for user_cache

Since we intend to invalidate the user_cache, and properties and caching
decorators don't play nicely, we split this into the property and a
getter which can be called explicitly.

Note that this test also uncovered a bug in user_cache, which was that
it called a non-existent task.

Change-Id: Ica04a82242cf4724155f99de5b8d3d9c356a8ec4

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-17 05:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_rebuild_server.py', 'shade/tests/unit/base.py', 'shade/tests/base.py'], 'message': "MonkeyPatch time.sleep in unit tests to avoid wait

There's no need to wait real world seconds when there are no real
world servers at the other end of these API calls. We still do wait a
little bit of time, in case there is some reliance on actually having
called the real time.sleep, but this should feed up test running in
a loop quite a bit.

Also lowering timeout on rebuild_server as it unnecessarily sleeps
for 1 second.

Change-Id: Ic26e90af12aedbedfbe0cc468332b921516a8409
"}]
commit_message:
MonkeyPatch time.sleep in unit tests to avoid wait

There's no need to wait real world seconds when there are no real
world servers at the other end of these API calls. We still do wait a
little bit of time, in case there is some reliance on actually having
called the real time.sleep, but this should feed up test running in
a loop quite a bit.

Also lowering timeout on rebuild_server as it unnecessarily sleeps
for 1 second.

Change-Id: Ic26e90af12aedbedfbe0cc468332b921516a8409

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

commit_message:
neutron: reduce complexity of allocate_for_instance (security_groups)

This pulls the security_group filtering loop out of
allocate_for_instance and into it's own private helper method.

Adds more documentation and cleans up the code a bit for readability.

commit_message:
Add /usr/local/bin in exec_dirs

Devstack installs some of the neutron utilities into /usr/local/bin.
In stead of adding individual filters to allow them to run from that
directory, this patch adds /usr/local/bin into exec_dirs.

A followup patch will remove local filters for metadata_proxy

Closes-Bug: 1435971
Change-Id: I3abd1c173121dc8abb5738d1879db8ac9a98b690

commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: Ifa211a8bd8d18d9b9b97bce8610587c829b94324

subject: Temporarily ignore requirements on master libs
revisions:

We need to disable checks of master branch requirements in libraries
so we can release updated versions of all libs that have no capped
requirements. We can restore the checks when that is done, and then
we'll look into ways to update the tools to not update caps on
library projects.

http://logs.openstack.org/32/174532/1/check/gate-python-heatclient-requirements/ba4c6dd/console.html#_2015-04-16_19_03_49_535

Change-Id: I4e4ac0580b9a1a98cc5cc9ba62d6977324a15296
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily ignore requirements on master libs

We need to disable checks of master branch requirements in libraries
so we can release updated versions of all libs that have no capped
requirements. We can restore the checks when that is done, and then
we'll look into ways to update the tools to not update caps on
library projects.

http://logs.openstack.org/32/174532/1/check/gate-python-heatclient-requirements/ba4c6dd/console.html#_2015-04-16_19_03_49_535

commit_message:
The sahara-tox-py27-scenario-unit job should be voting since kilo

This jobs already working ok for some some time as non-voting check job
and now we're ready to enable it as voting for branches starts with kilo.
In addition to it, this change is needed to stop running this job for
stable/juno where this tests were not yet implemented.

subject: Remove concatenation in csv file
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-14 22:50:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/overview/templates/overview/usage.csv', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/overview/templates/overview/usage.csv'], 'message': 'Remove concatenation in csv file

The download CSV summary file from both the Admin and Project
overview pages includes concatenation in its contents.
The : needs to be included as part of the label so translators
have control of spacing. Note that the commas are part of the
CSV file format and should not be translated.

Change-Id: I13137fda9b3e93edf97a7539044e791d04017ea7
Closes-Bug: 1444135
'}]
commit_message:
Remove concatenation in csv file

The download CSV summary file from both the Admin and Project
overview pages includes concatenation in its contents.
The : needs to be included as part of the label so translators
have control of spacing. Note that the commas are part of the
CSV file format and should not be translated.

Change-Id: I13137fda9b3e93edf97a7539044e791d04017ea7
Closes-Bug: 1444135

subject: [install-guide] Remove use_namespaces option
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-20 14:30:11.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-network-node.xml'], 'message': '[install-guide] Remove use_namespaces option

In the l3_agent.ini and dhcp_agent.ini files, remove the
deprecated use_namespaces option because minimum Linux
kernel versions support namespaces. Option defaults to
"true" until removal of the option in Liberty.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I8013c468d9fd9834b769bf24998c2214e7106e83
'}]
commit_message:
[install-guide] Remove use_namespaces option

In the l3_agent.ini and dhcp_agent.ini files, remove the
deprecated use_namespaces option because minimum Linux
kernel versions support namespaces. Option defaults to
"true" until removal of the option in Liberty.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I8013c468d9fd9834b769bf24998c2214e7106e83

subject: Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-17 21:59:07.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/nagios_wrapper.py'], 'message': 'Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail

Checks processed by the nagios_wrapper typically contain a text string
and return code.  The text string is submitted to the API as valueMeta
'detail'.  However, if the Nagios check does not return a text string,
the 'detail' field is empty, this condition has been known to cause an
UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY error in the API ("valueMeta detail cannot have an
empty value").

This change prevents valueMeta 'detail' from being submitted to the API
if the Nagios check outputs no text string along with its return code.

Change-Id: Ic6b584d6f988323d25676ebbdbdbe3edd06c4c3a
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail

Checks processed by the nagios_wrapper typically contain a text string
and return code.  The text string is submitted to the API as valueMeta
'detail'.  However, if the Nagios check does not return a text string,
the 'detail' field is empty, this condition has been known to cause an
UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY error in the API ("valueMeta detail cannot have an
empty value").

This change prevents valueMeta 'detail' from being submitted to the API
if the Nagios check outputs no text string along with its return code.

Change-Id: Ic6b584d6f988323d25676ebbdbdbe3edd06c4c3a

subject: Adds support for container selection for backup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 16:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/volume/v1/backup.py'], 'message': 'Adds support for container selection for backup

Changed argument from parsed_args.volume to parsed_args.container as per what
is expected in python-cinderclient.

If not defined, defaults to "backup_swift_container" in cinder.conf.

Stops there being a container for every volume you take backups off.

Change-Id: I4a34894222f71b0f207d007c32427040589406aa
Closes-Bug: 1446751
'}]
commit_message:
Adds support for container selection for backup

Changed argument from parsed_args.volume to parsed_args.container as per what
is expected in python-cinderclient.

If not defined, defaults to "backup_swift_container" in cinder.conf.

Stops there being a container for every volume you take backups off.

Change-Id: I4a34894222f71b0f207d007c32427040589406aa
Closes-Bug: 1446751

commit_message:
Install Guide: Use usual enable/start wording for Sahara

Use the same wording and flow for starting and enabling a service as

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-21 14:30:35.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.rootwrap.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/stevedore.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.log.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslotest.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/tooz.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.i18n.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.messaging.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/taskflow.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.utils.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.serialization.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/debtcollector.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.db.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslosphinx.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.middleware.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.config.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.concurrency.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.policy.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/oslo.vmware.config'], 'message': "Use Oslo core teams for stable maint, too

The Oslo team has decided to fold stable maintenance work into the
responsibilities of the core teams (we're small and the overlap on the
teams was approaching 100% anyway).

This change removes the exclusiveGroupPermissions settings for the stable
branches, making the remaining settings additive. It then adds the
stable-maint-core team so they can assist the various Oslo teams.

Change-Id: Ie4031cbe1ebe7f089a70e1946e234dac07727e85
"}]
commit_message:
Use Oslo core teams for stable maint, too

The Oslo team has decided to fold stable maintenance work into the
responsibilities of the core teams (we're small and the overlap on the
teams was approaching 100% anyway).

This change removes the exclusiveGroupPermissions settings for the stable
branches, making the remaining settings additive. It then adds the
stable-maint-core team so they can assist the various Oslo teams.

Change-Id: Ie4031cbe1ebe7f089a70e1946e234dac07727e85

subject: Fixes 500 error message and traces when no free ip is left
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15237, 'name': 'Anand Shanmugam', 'email': 'anand1712@gmail.com', 'username': 'anand1712'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-17 16:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/attach_interfaces.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/attach_interfaces.py'], 'message': 'Fixes 500 error message and traces when no free ip is left

When trying to attach a network to an instance if there are
no free fixed ips available nova-api presently throws a 500
internal server error.This is because the NoMoreFixedIps is
not handled properly by the attach-interfaces code flow.This
fix handles the exception and returns a bad request to the user.

(cherry picked from commit 82bf96fb0b3997680069dc2b1f772a46964cb9a9)

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/attach_interfaces.py
	nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_attach_interfaces.py

Closes-Bug: #1424594
Change-Id: I870177f51fa7546808c505a1f9476c195c3afaf2
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes 500 error message and traces when no free ip is left

When trying to attach a network to an instance if there are
no free fixed ips available nova-api presently throws a 500
internal server error.This is because the NoMoreFixedIps is
not handled properly by the attach-interfaces code flow.This
fix handles the exception and returns a bad request to the user.

(cherry picked from commit 82bf96fb0b3997680069dc2b1f772a46964cb9a9)

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/attach_interfaces.py
	nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_attach_interfaces.py

Closes-Bug: #1424594
Change-Id: I870177f51fa7546808c505a1f9476c195c3afaf2

commit_message:
Angular alert/messaging service

Rewrite existing Horizon alerts in Angular. To use,
inject 'toastService' as dependency, and call service
methods, e.g.

toastService.add('success', 'User successfully updated.').

Refactor patch to follow.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Co-Authored-By: Cindy Lu <clu@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I7d3f0897d1064830865fa9077342b6575c3e9ff7

subject: Fixes Hyper-V dynamic memory issue with vNUMA
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5367, 'name': 'boden', 'email': 'bodenvmw@gmail.com', 'username': 'boden'}, {'_account_id': 5520, 'name': 'Luis Fern√°ndez √Ålvarez', 'email': 'luis.fernandez.alvarez@cern.ch', 'username': 'luis-fernandez-alvarez'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-21 16:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vmutilsv2.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmutilsv2.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmutils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V dynamic memory issue with vNUMA

vNUMA and dynamic memory are mutually exclusive, so the former
needs to be disabled for instances where dynamic memory is enabled.

Change-Id: Ic730c294ffc89925076688a44adf2594c7f6712b
Closes-Bug: #1305897
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V dynamic memory issue with vNUMA

vNUMA and dynamic memory are mutually exclusive, so the former
needs to be disabled for instances where dynamic memory is enabled.

Change-Id: Ic730c294ffc89925076688a44adf2594c7f6712b
Closes-Bug: #1305897

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

commit_message:
Remove scripts for migrating nova baremetal

In juno, ironic provided support for migrating from nova's
"baremetal" driver to its "ironic" driver. These scripts
were used for that.

The baremetal driver was removed from nova in kilo. Ironic
doesn't support migrating from pre-kilo nova's baremetal
driver to post-juno nova's ironic driver.

Hence, deleting these migration scripts.

Closes-Bug: #1446330
Change-Id: Ic4990caa83a2eca3ee9fbd105bfe0a12bdaa7efe

commit_message:
[Docs] Various fixes

* Remove obsolete rst files
* Structural changes: added a folder "miscellaneous" for articles not included
  in the main tree

* Task templates lesson is now the 4th in the tutorial

commit_message:

drbd-devstack into stackforge section.

horizon-salt-formula, keystone-salt-formula,  neutron-salt-formula,
nova-salt-formula, openstack-salt-formula, stacktach-*: these dummy entries are not needed.

Remove ec2-driver, milk, tricircle: zuul uses no jobs, so the
definitions are not needed.

Avoid calling neutron.db.api.get_engine().pool.dispose() if
an engine facade has not yet been created since there won't
be any connections to get rid of. Calling it on services
that do not use the DB (e.g. agents) unnecessarily creates
a database connection engine that will never be used.

Change-Id: I3dbad1bef5da7b3765898e7d539b4d119b89e73a
Closes-Bug: #1433536
"}]
commit_message:
Only call get_engine().pool.dispose if _FACADE

Avoid calling neutron.db.api.get_engine().pool.dispose() if
an engine facade has not yet been created since there won't
be any connections to get rid of. Calling it on services
that do not use the DB (e.g. agents) unnecessarily creates
a database connection engine that will never be used.

Change-Id: I3dbad1bef5da7b3765898e7d539b4d119b89e73a
Closes-Bug: #1433536

commit_message:
Map directly rules with keywords.

Mapping engine should be able to use remote rules with keywords such as
``any_one_of`` or ``not_any_of`` as input for direct mapping.

Change-Id: I3f150d7ca4f53469a1037f6e3c26d9954b10b851
Closes-Bug: #1401057

subject: Add test for execute[nova:action(...)]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-21 15:55:53.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/materialized.py', 'congress/tests/policy_engines/test_agnostic.py', 'congress/tests/test_congress.py', 'congress/datalog/compile.py', 'congress/datalog/base.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py', 'congress/dse/deepsix.py', 'congress/datalog/database.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': "Add test for execute[nova:action(...)]

Added an end-to-end test for writing 'execute' policy statements
and fixed the bugs that came up.

The test does the obvious thing:
user writes a policy statement with 'execute', and then the test
ensures that when appropriate the action is called on the appropriate
service.  To succeed, the policy engine must successfully send
a request over the DSE, and the service on the other side must
successfully execute the correct action. (Of course, the action
is mocked out, but that code must be run with the correct arguments.)

Change-Id: I93ab4fd5c26278a587165a70211bb3fe621fac31
"}]
commit_message:
Add test for execute[nova:action(...)]

Added an end-to-end test for writing 'execute' policy statements
and fixed the bugs that came up.

The test does the obvious thing:
user writes a policy statement with 'execute', and then the test
ensures that when appropriate the action is called on the appropriate
service.  To succeed, the policy engine must successfully send
a request over the DSE, and the service on the other side must
successfully execute the correct action. (Of course, the action
is mocked out, but that code must be run with the correct arguments.)

Change-Id: I93ab4fd5c26278a587165a70211bb3fe621fac31

commit_message:
Introduce `tools/kolla` to interact with kolla

This is supposed to prevent proliferation of scripts in "tools"
directory and reduce code duplication.

This first patch replaces tools/{start,stop,pull,status} scripts and
more commands are to be added in the future.

Change-Id: I3d99cf5033be8631d8e6f32a4c34d3b5ffcae7e8

commit_message:
support specify user-id when create sample and alarm

The change of I9ba984f804aecee5b63e5a86e699733040dee245 enables
us to specify os-user-id in CLI, but it shadows the user-id when
creating sample and alarm, this patch fixes it as what we've done
for project-id.

commit_message:
connection-create/delete to report correct error

The patch set fixes the problem described in the launchpad
bug 1446218 where l2-gateway-connection-create and
l2-gateway-connection-delete report internal server error
instead of correct error that will hint the user to
the right problem area.

Change-Id: I329a4b36ea26482bf69a4afe2a1e0b1271f752ec
Closes-Bug: 1446218

subject: Make SoftwareDeployments work for non-CREATE actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-15 19:45:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py', 'heat/tests/test_software_deployment.py'], 'message': "Make SoftwareDeployments work for non-CREATE actions

Currently we only create the deployment if the actions list includes
CREATE, but its valid to create e.g DELETE only deployments, which
curently won't work.  So determine whether to create the deployment
on the resource_id instead of via the action, which resolves this problem.

Change-Id: Ia563f4130c31baa4dcee3be3786ea3c49b6bad98
Closes-Bug: #1444087
(cherry picked from commit 0d4235015065a814f7e76f4a34d422146c58ec72)
"}]
commit_message:
Make SoftwareDeployments work for non-CREATE actions

Currently we only create the deployment if the actions list includes
CREATE, but its valid to create e.g DELETE only deployments, which
curently won't work.  So determine whether to create the deployment
on the resource_id instead of via the action, which resolves this problem.

Change-Id: Ia563f4130c31baa4dcee3be3786ea3c49b6bad98
Closes-Bug: #1444087
(cherry picked from commit 0d4235015065a814f7e76f4a34d422146c58ec72)

subject: Update PM pooling defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-18 09:54:53.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_pool_manager/test_service.py', 'etc/designate/designate.conf.sample', 'designate/pool_manager/__init__.py'], 'message': "Update PM pooling defaults

Based on testing with multiple PM/mDNS/Nameservers etc in
a production-ish deploy, increasing these counts and
intervals reduces the chances of a zone entering ERROR state
and requiring correction via the periodic sync/recovery
timers.

The tests currently hardcode some of the config values as
expected arguments, we'll want to fix this up to be less
brittle ASAP.

Change-Id: Ib999a6b21ab271c1c46bca5319e5ba204fe951c1
"}]
commit_message:
Update PM pooling defaults

Based on testing with multiple PM/mDNS/Nameservers etc in
a production-ish deploy, increasing these counts and
intervals reduces the chances of a zone entering ERROR state
and requiring correction via the periodic sync/recovery
timers.

The tests currently hardcode some of the config values as
expected arguments, we'll want to fix this up to be less
brittle ASAP.

Change-Id: Ib999a6b21ab271c1c46bca5319e5ba204fe951c1

subject: Openstackdocstheme: log-a-bug prefills wrong source file
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-21 05:33:24.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/script_footer.html'], 'message': 'Openstackdocstheme: log-a-bug prefills wrong source file

When clicking on the bug icon on RST-based documentation
pages, the launchpad page that is opened sports a wrong
link to the source file.
Current code assumes that all source files reside in the
same directory as the conf.py file. This assumption is
wrong; source files may well live in subdirectories.

The fix is in script_footer.html. The Javascript code
used to use Jinja2 variable "sourcename", which doesn't
contain the subdirectory of a source file.
This is changed to "pagename", which does.

Change-Id: I3289f6c7a672fbc20c0d9e1183c65ffa49d4db9d
Closes-Bug: #1446444
'}]
commit_message:
Openstackdocstheme: log-a-bug prefills wrong source file

When clicking on the bug icon on RST-based documentation
pages, the launchpad page that is opened sports a wrong
link to the source file.
Current code assumes that all source files reside in the
same directory as the conf.py file. This assumption is
wrong; source files may well live in subdirectories.

The fix is in script_footer.html. The Javascript code
used to use Jinja2 variable "sourcename", which doesn't
contain the subdirectory of a source file.
This is changed to "pagename", which does.

Change-Id: I3289f6c7a672fbc20c0d9e1183c65ffa49d4db9d
Closes-Bug: #1446444

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-17 20:43:15.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_service_provider/ini_setting_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/neutron_service_provider.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_service_provider/ini_setting.rb', 'manifests/config.pp'], 'message': 'Adding neutron_service_provider type

Currently, in the neutron server config, multiple keys, each named
"service_provider", must be specified in the "service_providers" section.
The current implementation comma separates each value mapped to a
single "service_provider" key. The ini provider used does not allow for
the existence of multiple same key, different value pairs. This
workaround resolves the issue for the service provider.

Change-Id: I0798add40fe50a13180d8092b37056937496c87d
'}]
commit_message:
Adding neutron_service_provider type

Currently, in the neutron server config, multiple keys, each named
"service_provider", must be specified in the "service_providers" section.
The current implementation comma separates each value mapped to a
single "service_provider" key. The ini provider used does not allow for
the existence of multiple same key, different value pairs. This
workaround resolves the issue for the service provider.

Change-Id: I0798add40fe50a13180d8092b37056937496c87d

commit_message:
Update for changes in k8s 0.15

* Migrated to v1beta3 API
* cAdvisor is now enabled by default
* command line daemon settings updated
* HAproxy template updated for multi-port services
* Better reporting

Change-Id: Iefcbe8073fb35503e2fe2ee5c6bf4610561c3cb6
Closes-Bug: #1446306

commit_message:
Revert "Add support for customized cluster name"

This reverts commit f5895fe819646f1b30b83b9d28cbaa75ff5dffc4.

New configuration options are not allowed in stable branches
unless they fix a major issue. In this case, it is definitely
a new feature.

commit_message:
Refactor how we are doing packaging

This commit is a squashed version of commits that
implement packaging of fuel components. In order to
make our packaging process better I had to introduce
some new macros and do additional cleanup.

The main paradigm that we are following with this commit is
the following:

1 GIT REPO -> 1 PACKAGING SPEC -> N PACKAGES

Though it would be ideal to have only one package per git repo,
but this is left for further releases

This change is very essential to make updates process easier
as we provide only one type of artifacts that a user can fetch -
distro-specific package

This particular commit does not introduce new DEB packages
(such as packages of OCF scripts and other binaries that
we currently put onto the slave nodes with puppet instead of
installing them as packages) which will be introduced as
a part of whole packaging initiative a little bit later

1) Add prepare_git_source macro
This change is important to always
checkout the code from git working
or we can end up with garbage getting
into package source code and add
version.txt file to source archives

2) Remove nailgun-redhat-license package
This package is obsolete - we do not need
it.

3) Package fuel-library into RPM package

4) Delete old packages and misc stuff

This change is a little cleanup of python-tasklib
and other leftovers

5) Change RPM sandbox configuration

Change RPM sandbox configuration to use upstream mirrors
to be able to install nailgun build dependencies

6) Alter Nailgun spec

a) Change nailgun spec to use NPM during package
build
b) Switch nailgun to prepare_git_source
c) Package all packages of fuel-web repo using
only nailgun.spec

7) Alter RPM sandbox preparation to install build-deps

8) Package astute and mcagents using astute.spec

9) Include all built RPMs

Include all RPMS that were built inside the sandbox

10) Package fuel-ostf with git-archive

11) Build python-fuelclient using git_archive macro

12) Move specs to particular git repositories

13) Rename fuel-library and ostf to make macros easier
14)Adjust build scripts to fetch specs from particular
fuel repositories

FUEL DEB-packaging related code

15) Restore part of make system code for DEB packages building

16) Nailgun debian spec files for all nailgun-based packages

17) Clean up SANDBOX for Ubuntu generation

18) Clean up some package building scripts

19) Put PACKAGE_VERSION variable into the top config.mk

20) Add dockerctl and change fuel-library tar.tg path

21) Move deb rules to particula repos

22) Allow to rebuild deb repo with reprepro on-the-fly

24) Fix repocleanup stanza to parse source packages metadata

25) Debmirror whole repos in order not to break reprepro

26) Make docker image build depend on late RPM packages
or it may lead to race conditions

27) Clean up old deb packages with one shot instead
of parallel run

Change-Id: I15ae4d0abe51c72b28793e1a1ef30fec0f668b73
Blueprint: package-fuel-components

subject: Fix bug in execute[nova:p(x)]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-20 22:57:57.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/policy_engines/test_agnostic.py', 'congress/datalog/compile.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py'], 'message': 'Fix bug in execute[nova:p(x)]

If the name of the action was qualified by the name of the service
the contents of execute[nova:p(x)] was always empty and so the trigger
would fail to execute.

The root cause of the bug was in computing the name of this table for
the dependency graph: the name of this table was simply nova:p when
in reality it should have been <policy>:nova:p.

Change-Id: I7baa79569b5147dfe611af7b3e09a6a44a1593ee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in execute[nova:p(x)]

If the name of the action was qualified by the name of the service
the contents of execute[nova:p(x)] was always empty and so the trigger
would fail to execute.

The root cause of the bug was in computing the name of this table for
the dependency graph: the name of this table was simply nova:p when
in reality it should have been <policy>:nova:p.

Change-Id: I7baa79569b5147dfe611af7b3e09a6a44a1593ee

subject: Improve arity computation
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-20 22:57:57.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/topdown.py', 'congress/tests/policy_engines/test_agnostic.py', 'congress/datalog/compile.py', 'congress/datalog/base.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py', 'congress/datalog/nonrecursive.py', 'congress/api/row_model.py', 'congress/tests/datalog/test_nonrecur.py'], 'message': 'Improve arity computation

The arity computation was overly complex, and it sometimes failed to
compute the answer when modals were involved.  This change makes
the arity computation simpler and more robust.

Part of that simplicity comes from eliminating
the ability to compute arity using theories included
in each other.  But it seems we are not using that capability
since theory inclusion is only used by simulation,
and the simulation tests pass.

In the future, we should try to completely eliminate theory
inclusion if possible.

Change-Id: Ic376f92515621e29297ca456e1cd424e18c374fc
'}]
commit_message:
Improve arity computation

The arity computation was overly complex, and it sometimes failed to
compute the answer when modals were involved.  This change makes
the arity computation simpler and more robust.

Part of that simplicity comes from eliminating
the ability to compute arity using theories included
in each other.  But it seems we are not using that capability
since theory inclusion is only used by simulation,
and the simulation tests pass.

In the future, we should try to completely eliminate theory
inclusion if possible.

Change-Id: Ic376f92515621e29297ca456e1cd424e18c374fc

commit_message:
Add min/max of API microversions to version API

As nova-spec api-microversions, versions API needs to expose minimum
and maximum microversions to version API, because clients need to
know available microversions through the API. That is very important
for the interoperability.
This patch adds these versions as the nova-spec mentioned.

Note:
  As v2(not v2.1) API change manner, we have added new extensions if
  changing API. However, this patch doesn't add a new extension even
  if adding new parameters "version" and "min_version" because version
  API is independent from both v2 and v2.1 APIs.

Change-Id: Id464a07d624d0e228fe0aa66a04c8e51f292ba0c
Closes-Bug: #1443375
(cherry picked from commit 1830870718fe7472b47037f3331cfe59b5bdda07)
(cherry picked from commit 853671e912c6ad9a4605acad2575417911875cdd)

commit_message:
Add support for customized cluster name

Current RBD driver assumes ceph cluster name to be 'ceph', for
cluster has a different name, the driver won't be able to connect
to the cluster.  This change add a new config option
'rbd_cluster_name' to address this issue.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I02ae1a255fd613fce291cc7ddf90cfd9175255a8
Closes-bug: #1444855
(cherry picked from commit 6db57c53a1363ff267e58f88b0937cd5d0e842c4)

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-04-16 14:43:14.000000000', 'files': ['iso/bootstrap_admin_node.docker.sh'], 'message': "Split message about unpacking and loading images

User could think that master node installation hanged, as lrzip provided
total time and nothing happened next. After lrzip executes there is
additional message warning that image loading may take some time.

PipeViewer was thought of as possible mean to show progress bar to the
user, but because of the way `docker load` command works (it loads the
data first and then processes it) it wasn't a viable option.

To assure good user experience docker load should provide it's own
progress bar or any other indicator, but this change would need to be
made in docker itself.

Change-Id: I57a63a15adfef45a5e68861c91ff09dc281a15e4
Closes-Bug: #1439193
"}]
commit_message:
Split message about unpacking and loading images

User could think that master node installation hanged, as lrzip provided
total time and nothing happened next. After lrzip executes there is
additional message warning that image loading may take some time.

PipeViewer was thought of as possible mean to show progress bar to the
user, but because of the way `docker load` command works (it loads the
data first and then processes it) it wasn't a viable option.

To assure good user experience docker load should provide it's own
progress bar or any other indicator, but this change would need to be
made in docker itself.

Change-Id: I57a63a15adfef45a5e68861c91ff09dc281a15e4
Closes-Bug: #1439193

subject: Don't trace RHEL Registration scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-07 15:39:49.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rhel-common/os-refresh-config/pre-configure.d/06-rhel-registration', 'elements/rhel-common/pre-install.d/00-rhel-registration'], 'message': "Don't trace RHEL Registration scripts

We don't want to trace the RHEL registration scripts because that
is likely to log things like passwords and activation keys.  To
still allow for debugging failed runs, add sanitized logging of

the part of the process where problems are most likely to manifest.

Change-Id: I0f661e9c152f43b814fda61211bd56ba93e3b9dc
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trace RHEL Registration scripts

We don't want to trace the RHEL registration scripts because that
is likely to log things like passwords and activation keys.  To
still allow for debugging failed runs, add sanitized logging of
the arguments passed to the registration commands, since that is
the part of the process where problems are most likely to manifest.

Change-Id: I0f661e9c152f43b814fda61211bd56ba93e3b9dc

subject: Fix apply_changes function race condition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 16:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/corosync/lib/puppet/provider/corosync.rb'], 'message': 'Fix apply_changes function race condition

Due to an error in logic of apply_changes method
we had problems with parallel deployment of controllers
as we were generating XML patch between live CIB and
shadow generated on the base of (sometimes!) older CIB.

This could lead to the problem that crm_diff removes
some of the data from the live CIB as it was not present
in the old CIB.

An example of such behaviour is the bug with location
constraints missing for virtual ip addresses as our
service provider was creating them in this window
between shadow creation and retrieving of the live CIB
thus crm_diff was generating patch removing this location
and leading to this bug.

Change-Id: Icb28fe6d90f44084d424b793db792869e0c6c66c
Closes-bug: #1396481
'}]
commit_message:
Fix apply_changes function race condition

Due to an error in logic of apply_changes method
we had problems with parallel deployment of controllers
as we were generating XML patch between live CIB and
shadow generated on the base of (sometimes!) older CIB.

This could lead to the problem that crm_diff removes
some of the data from the live CIB as it was not present
in the old CIB.

An example of such behaviour is the bug with location
constraints missing for virtual ip addresses as our
service provider was creating them in this window
between shadow creation and retrieving of the live CIB
thus crm_diff was generating patch removing this location
and leading to this bug.

Change-Id: Icb28fe6d90f44084d424b793db792869e0c6c66c
Closes-bug: #1396481

commit_message:
Pin neutron to stable/kilo

Since the *aaS repositories require a dependency on neutron, we want
to pin the stable branches to the matching neutron branch.

Change-Id: Id8d2663e50b62915c2ed6426e378920042f9eed4

commit_message:
New config group for oslo_versionedobjects

Lot of projects use fatal_exception_format_errors, we
need to separate out ours in its own group.

Closes-Bug: #1433647
Change-Id: I7a53ed2c5b2387214c4edba7295cb800e12f47a9

commit_message:
Add license information

* LICENSE file placed to every package
* License information is shown during application creation
* License added to every file

Change-Id: I682f3d9a09d0c0b575206d79223c1822c4b94f27
Closes-Bug: #1446121

commit_message:
Update for changes in k8s 0.15

* Migrated to v1beta3 API
* cAdvisor is now enabled by default
* command line daemon settings updated
* HAproxy template updated for multi-port services
* Better reporting

Change-Id: Iefcbe8073fb35503e2fe2ee5c6bf4610561c3cb6
Closes-Bug: #1446306
Closes-Bug: #1445541

* Make decision based on missing lines not difference

* Fix issue in case when stash has elements but

commit_message:
Improve coverage job

* Make decision based on missing lines not difference
  between percentage of coverage.

* Fix issue in case when stash has elements but
  there is no changes to stash. We pop stash only
  if coverage job created it

* Changes in UX:

  * Show diff of coverage reports if proposed patch
    coverage is less than in master

  * Better UI messages

Change-Id: If02b55b84018102d2ea9645bf27048818e0d31c3

subject: Removes existing network namespaces for neutron-agents container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 07:52:01.000000000', 'files': ['docker/neutron/neutron-agents/config-scripts/config-dhcp-agent.sh', 'docker/neutron/neutron-agents/config-scripts/config-l3-agent.sh'], 'message': "Removes existing network namespaces for neutron-agents container

Previously, network namespaces would not work correctly when
restarting or stop/rm/start the neutron-agents container. This
is because network namespaces created within the container are
associated to the container's pid: /pid/$CONTAINER_PID/ns/net.
With this patch, when a container starts or restarts, the l3/dhcp
agent start scripts will remove any existing qrouter/qdhcp network
namespaces before starting the agents. The agents will recreate the
necessary network namespaces since they are stored in the db.

Closes-Bug: 1444219

Change-Id: Ia86729766fe8c2fc145b3a02d519746b149a73bb
"}]
commit_message:
Removes existing network namespaces for neutron-agents container

Previously, network namespaces would not work correctly when
restarting or stop/rm/start the neutron-agents container. This
is because network namespaces created within the container are
associated to the container's pid: /pid/$CONTAINER_PID/ns/net.
With this patch, when a container starts or restarts, the l3/dhcp
agent start scripts will remove any existing qrouter/qdhcp network
namespaces before starting the agents. The agents will recreate the
necessary network namespaces since they are stored in the db.

Closes-Bug: 1444219

Change-Id: Ia86729766fe8c2fc145b3a02d519746b149a73bb

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-17 08:42:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_fixed_ip.py', 'nova/objects/fixed_ip.py'], 'message': "Added backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP

When backporting a FixedIP object to the version 1.1 and less
we must backport Network object to version 1.1, because since
version 1.2, FixedIp object uses Network object v1.2.

This backporting is needed when we use Juno control and
Icehouse compute. In this case Juno nova-conductor sends back
a FixedIP object of version 1.1 with an embedded Network
object of 1.2, icehouse then incorrectly tries to backport
the FixedIP object again (as opposed to the Network object)
leading to a loop.

More information in the bug description.

It's not a cherry-pick from master because this is the
old (manual) way of calculating backports and master uses
a new (automated) mechanism.

Master patch: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460

Closes-Bug: #1408498

Change-Id: I27d45bd8c0b0f50c3fbc1cff70815c1205f04f5c
"}]
commit_message:
Added backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP

When backporting a FixedIP object to the version 1.1 and less
we must backport Network object to version 1.1, because since
version 1.2, FixedIp object uses Network object v1.2.

This backporting is needed when we use Juno control and
Icehouse compute. In this case Juno nova-conductor sends back
a FixedIP object of version 1.1 with an embedded Network
object of 1.2, icehouse then incorrectly tries to backport
the FixedIP object again (as opposed to the Network object)
leading to a loop.

More information in the bug description.

It's not a cherry-pick from master because this is the
old (manual) way of calculating backports and master uses
a new (automated) mechanism.

Master patch: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460

Closes-Bug: #1408498

Change-Id: I27d45bd8c0b0f50c3fbc1cff70815c1205f04f5c

commit_message:
Add timeout for keystoneclient session

Currently, we only apply timeout on ceilometer api, but not on keystone
api as well, this is not consistent. Keystone api may be slow, or worse,
stuck, then ceilometerclient will not return timely. This issue has caused
availability problem in our environment when ceilometer alarm service
has been running for a long time.

Change-Id: I0d5f82ff9cf4132a1de2f0b649908483326e116e
Closes-Bug: #1436249
(cherry picked from commit 44af2d4087815d5d451305b549f91ab6130528c0)

commit_message:
add region_name to auth plugin parameters

If endpoint is not specified, then auth plugin will request to keystone
to get target endpoint, however, we don't provide region name for it,
this will cause critical issue in multiple region scenario.

Change-Id: I99ceafec25072988435018ca1affbd778ca9b22f
Closes-Bug: #1439553
(cherry picked from commit bfb6d122fa99d94a61aea4432f74cbbf3f5d03cc)

commit_message:
ceilometerclient insecure argument no longer works

The os_insecure argument needs to be parsed and passed to the auth
plugin for non-shell usage.

Change-Id: Id45a680396a9b646b273d971a0f6c274e95019a6
Closes-Bug: #1438750
(cherry picked from commit a5df77d8730284e278fde087e8bb3c2520c6ddb1)

commit_message:
Added integration  test for test_vcenter with vlan manager and  vCenter as backend for Glance.

Scenario:
1. Create cluster with vCenter support
2. Add 3 nodes with controller role
3. Add a node with compute role
4. Add a node with Cinder VMDK role
5. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend
6. Configure vCenter datastore as backend for glance
7. Deploy the cluster
8. Run network verification
9. Run OSTF

Closes-bug: #1442063

Change-Id: I6d8fc3e8f09030cfe4a31cea6678c3c9a92e54e1

subject: Handle (dis|re)connect more appropriately.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-16 15:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['reviewstats/utils.py'], 'message': 'Handle (dis|re)connect more appropriately.

This code was reconnecting via ssh on every iteration of the loop,
which is completely unnecessary.  It should use the existing
connection and only reconnect if there was an SSH error when exeuting
a command.  The code should also explicitly close the connection when
its done.

Change-Id: I2545a1ca5e0cd39a8b453445ea25927756b1fd19
'}]
commit_message:
Handle (dis|re)connect more appropriately.

This code was reconnecting via ssh on every iteration of the loop,
which is completely unnecessary.  It should use the existing
connection and only reconnect if there was an SSH error when exeuting
a command.  The code should also explicitly close the connection when
its done.

Change-Id: I2545a1ca5e0cd39a8b453445ea25927756b1fd19

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-02 02:07:00.000000000', 'files': ['saharaclient/api/job_binary_internals.py', 'saharaclient/api/shell.py'], 'message': 'add --name option to assign name to job-binary-internal

In CLI command(job-binary-data-create)
job-binary-internal is automatically named by creation-date.
This fix add --name for job-binary-data-create
to assign name to job-binary-internal.
If we do not use --name, job-binary-internal named
basename of args.filename.
If we use stdin, job-binary-internal named by creation-date
the same as bofore.
Examples:
sahara job-binary-data-create --file /tmp/fuga.txt  --name hoge
 => job-binary-internal is named  hoge
sahara job-binary-data-create --file /tmp/fuga.txt
 => job-binary-internal is named filename(fuga.txt)
sahara job-binary-data-create < stdin
 => job-binary-internal is named creation-date

Change-Id: I368b8c82bc87962d69dda175e410e230e0d3beab
Closes-Bug: #1428537
'}]
commit_message:
add --name option to assign name to job-binary-internal

In CLI command(job-binary-data-create)
job-binary-internal is automatically named by creation-date.
This fix add --name for job-binary-data-create
to assign name to job-binary-internal.
If we do not use --name, job-binary-internal named
basename of args.filename.
If we use stdin, job-binary-internal named by creation-date
the same as bofore.
Examples:
sahara job-binary-data-create --file /tmp/fuga.txt  --name hoge
 => job-binary-internal is named  hoge
sahara job-binary-data-create --file /tmp/fuga.txt
 => job-binary-internal is named filename(fuga.txt)
sahara job-binary-data-create < stdin
 => job-binary-internal is named creation-date

Change-Id: I368b8c82bc87962d69dda175e410e230e0d3beab
Closes-Bug: #1428537

commit_message:
Skip test on cells job which will not pass

The ec2 test_compute_with_volumes test will not pass with cells since it
relies on security groups which are not supported.  It should be skipped
until such a time as cells supports security groups.

Change-Id: I0f29efdd3853ec3038f5944607e9bec9a7615a14

commit_message:
Create Nova Scheduler Base Image Weighter

Add a new nova scheduler weighter, sort the filter hosts
according to whether there is a base image on a host,
aims to booting instances at a faster speed for the
first time and reducing the image download in a way.

Change-Id: I91c3923ad1bab4592702c4e8b37ac87914d901f0
Implements: blueprint base-image-weighter-create

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-04-16 10:52:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/smbfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_remotefs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py'], 'message': 'SMBFS: Lock on a per-volume basis

This allows operations that do not conflict with each
other (i.e. are on different volumes) to run concurrently.
The prior locking scheme was too coarse and essentially
made the driver single-threaded.

This patch moves the implementation of the GlusterFS driver locking
scheme to the RemoteFS base driver so that other similar volume
drivers can use it.

Closes-Bug: #1439352
Change-Id: I37be14e7525406e0ad568f6228c1303998c5235f
'}]
commit_message:
SMBFS: Lock on a per-volume basis

This allows operations that do not conflict with each
other (i.e. are on different volumes) to run concurrently.
The prior locking scheme was too coarse and essentially
made the driver single-threaded.

This patch moves the implementation of the GlusterFS driver locking
scheme to the RemoteFS base driver so that other similar volume
drivers can use it.

Closes-Bug: #1439352

subject: Fix RabbitMQ OCF stop action when no PIDFILE exists
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 09:28:51.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Fix RabbitMQ OCF stop action when no PIDFILE exists

W/o this patch, RabbitMQ OCF action stop would fail
if there is no pid file exist. This is an issue as that
could leave the beam process running and uncontrolled
by the Pacemaker resource agent.

The solution is to invoke 'rabbitmqctl stop' and return generic
error only if this operation have failed as well or timed out.
For this case, there also should be a note provided in logs about
additional manual stop actions required.

Closes-bug: #1446526

Change-Id: I86272230bd7f0ef8412ccaeb6bbb5dcaa18387bc
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ OCF stop action when no PIDFILE exists

W/o this patch, RabbitMQ OCF action stop would fail
if there is no pid file exist. This is an issue as that
could leave the beam process running and uncontrolled
by the Pacemaker resource agent.

The solution is to invoke 'rabbitmqctl stop' and return generic
error only if this operation have failed as well or timed out.
For this case, there also should be a note provided in logs about
additional manual stop actions required.

Closes-bug: #1446526

Change-Id: I86272230bd7f0ef8412ccaeb6bbb5dcaa18387bc
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: Ieab43148a8d77d5896f02dd96d54097cc3d2e37b

DB2 doesn't support alter column type from string to text,
need to add a new column and copy data from old column, and
later remove the old column.

Change-Id: I7b3edf6bf7ea0efaf96398a83dad9ebe61caaa23

commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy migration script 061 for DB2 backend

DB2 doesn't support alter column type from string to text,
need to add a new column and copy data from old column, and
later remove the old column.

Closes-Bug: #1443252
Change-Id: I7b3edf6bf7ea0efaf96398a83dad9ebe61caaa23
(cherry picked from commit 7b25a9d6471a1a2d2d6441f7385d6d2bd00537ea)

commit_message:
task report: generate a JUnit report

This allows users to feed reports to tools such as Jenkins.

In rally/utils/junit_xml.py lies a copy of junit-xml, since the project seems
dead and the latest version is buggy.

Implements: blueprint task-report-junit
Change-Id: I5a16c7490b5e4fdbf29bbf201b9b09d719eecc8a

commit_message:
Failed to discovery when iscsi multipath and CHAP both enabled

Storage server may be configured to protect target discovering phase with CHAP
authentication, in this case existing discovery command will be failed in Nova
when iscsi multipath enabled. Nova need these below discovery auth properties.
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.authmethod",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.username",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.password"

Cinder Storage driver need to send discovery auth properties to Nova in this
case and the properties are:
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_method']
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_username']
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_password']

This issue not just for IBM Storwize, but also other storage drivers who need
CHAP authentication to do iscsi discover.
The according nova change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148516/

Closes-Bug: #1367189

Change-Id: Ib528eed3a9fd5006c1649ef42233e1f943c38ab6
(cherry picked from commit 3f781f32d0aaa6adf9ef6c54ab6114de92b64917)

commit_message:
Add ability to specify path var to testr

This keeps cinderclient/tests as the default test dir,
but it adds the ability to set specific paths via the
OS_TEST_PATH var, this way we can call on unit vs functional
tests (once the functional tests are in place of course).

Change-Id: Icdc703e4054af6d22f5886581efed07319ec0247

commit_message:
Use kwargs from compute v4 proxy change_instance_metadata

The args were passed to the compute manager method in the wrong order.
We noticed this in the gate with KeyError: 'uuid' in the logs because of
the LOG.debug statement in change_instance_metadata. Just use kwargs
like rpcapi would normally.

There isn't a unit test for this since the v4 proxy code goes away in
liberty, this is for getting it into stable/kilo.

Closes-Bug: #1444728

Change-Id: Ic988f48d99e626ee5773c97904e09dbf00c5414a
(cherry picked from commit e55f746ea8590cce7c2b07a023197f369251a7ef)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 979, 'name': 'Dave Walker', 'email': 'email@daviey.com', 'username': 'davewalker'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-16 17:32:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "compute: stop handling virt lifecycle events in cleanup_host()

When rebooting a compute host, guest VMs can be getting shutdown
automatically by the hypervisor and the virt driver is sending events to
the compute manager to handle them. If the compute service is still up
while this happens it will try to call the stop API to power off the
instance and update the database to show the instance as stopped.

When the compute service comes back up and events come in from the virt
driver that the guest VMs are running, nova will see that the vm_state
on the instance in the nova database is STOPPED and shut down the
instance by calling the stop API (basically ignoring what the virt
driver / hypervisor tells nova is the state of the guest VM).

Alternatively, if the compute service shuts down after changing the
intance task_state to 'powering-off' but before the stop API cast is
complete, the instance can be in a strange vm_state/task_state
combination that requires the admin to manually reset the task_state to
recover the instance.

Let's just try to avoid some of this mess by disconnecting the event
handling when the compute service is shutting down like we do for
neutron VIF plugging events. There could still be races here if the
compute service is shutting down after the hypervisor (e.g. libvirtd),
but this is at least a best attempt to do the mitigate the potential
damage.

Closes-Bug: #1444630
Related-Bug: #1293480
Related-Bug: #1408176

Change-Id: I1a321371dff7933cdd11d31d9f9c2a2f850fd8d9
(cherry picked from commit d1fb8d0fbdd6cb95c43b02f754409f1c728e8cd0)
"}]
commit_message:
compute: stop handling virt lifecycle events in cleanup_host()

When rebooting a compute host, guest VMs can be getting shutdown
automatically by the hypervisor and the virt driver is sending events to
the compute manager to handle them. If the compute service is still up
while this happens it will try to call the stop API to power off the
instance and update the database to show the instance as stopped.

When the compute service comes back up and events come in from the virt
driver that the guest VMs are running, nova will see that the vm_state
on the instance in the nova database is STOPPED and shut down the
instance by calling the stop API (basically ignoring what the virt
driver / hypervisor tells nova is the state of the guest VM).

Alternatively, if the compute service shuts down after changing the
intance task_state to 'powering-off' but before the stop API cast is
complete, the instance can be in a strange vm_state/task_state
combination that requires the admin to manually reset the task_state to
recover the instance.

Let's just try to avoid some of this mess by disconnecting the event
handling when the compute service is shutting down like we do for
neutron VIF plugging events. There could still be races here if the
compute service is shutting down after the hypervisor (e.g. libvirtd),
but this is at least a best attempt to do the mitigate the potential
damage.

Closes-Bug: #1444630
Related-Bug: #1293480
Related-Bug: #1408176

Change-Id: I1a321371dff7933cdd11d31d9f9c2a2f850fd8d9
(cherry picked from commit d1fb8d0fbdd6cb95c43b02f754409f1c728e8cd0)
